So leaving Trencin, Slovakia behind we
then drove north about two hours to the
city of Brno in the Czech Republic. Now one of the things that I instantly noticed when coming in to Brno how young
the population was how many people my age there were.. Now there is a reason for  that

Brno is a huge university towns over
30 different institute of higher

learning so, lots of university students
which one of them actually used to be my

dad. So my dad lived here in Brno for quite
a long period of time and he went to

school and University here. But of course
a trip to Brmo would not be complete

without a trip to the Castle. I tell
you a lot of castles on this trip. Castles
castles. This one is the Spilberk Castle.  Beautiful, beautiful Moravia castle

we drove out two hours and 45 minutes to
the city of České Budějovice
We are going on a tour of the Budweiser, Budvar Brewery. We're gonna have Czech
beer, awesome Czech beer I already tried this beer. Its delicious. We are going to learn how its brewed and all the other fun stuff that comes along with it
Brewery tour. Yes. Let me tell you, you do not come to the Czech Republic without
the mission of drinking beer because is litterary cheaper than water. This is not an exaggeration
So doing a Brewery tour was naturally a perfect thing to do. Now one of the benefits of staying in České Budějovice
which is why we stayed there is that you are about 20 25 minutes away to Cesky Krumlov which is a huge

tourist destination and our next destination. If
you've ever been on Pinterest I

guarantee you've seen a photo of this town. It is picture perfect so
beautiful
We made it to the top of the tower of the castle. Castle tower.  wow  its realy bright. Really bright.
Beautiful view. Pop quiz -- what is the difference between castle and palace?
Castles are meant to fortify cities and villages and palaces are meant to display wealth.
Boom internet. You did look that up did you? I did look that up on the internet.
Most of our time in Cesky Krumlov was spent wandering the streets there are so many cute little shops selling all sorts of
artisan products and oh my gosh amazing little restaurants
So we stopped of for a little treat here at Trdelnik. I don't know what it is? Is it bread or is it pretzel?
I think its like a pastry. Its kind of like a crape. Look, this is how they are rolled
This is so cool. Is it like a bread or a pretzel?
You know?
This is wheat. Oh i'ts wheat.
I looks really good. Ok Steph, try it
What does it taste like. Good? Sugary good? Sugary goodness. Awesome stuff. Crunchy cinnamon donuts, but better.
SO that was the extend of our visit to Cesky Krumlov, exploring and taking a lot of photos,  I took a lot of photos. And don't forget to follow me on instagram
